Text: Russia's invasion violates the basic right of self-determination. Strong sanctions can help deter Russia, but Pres Biden must also permit increased domestic energy production. Otherwise these sanctions will further increase energy prices for Americans already suffering inflation. https://t.co/59pV9fYqaA
Today we remember the service of two of America's greatest presidents – one who established this nation and one who fought to keep it. Happy Birthday to these great Americans! https://t.co/0iCQVvgBLR

On Feb. 19, 1942, President Roosevelt authorized the mass incarceration of over 120,000 Japanese Americans. #CA08's Manzanar Relocation Center is part of that heartbreaking history. Today, on the 80th anniversary, let us all commit to ensuring such injustice never again occurs. https://t.co/MBMeSPfoft

According to the new Department of Labor report, prices continued to rise at record rates in January, hurting American families at the grocery store and the gas pump. Congress must act now to reverse this trend by ending reckless government spending and... https://t.co/EId5QHaqtJ https://t.co/YurtXrCcfl

Tyler Wallasch has been skiing at Mammoth Mountain since he was two. Now, his Olympic journey begins with the Ski Cross in Beijing. Congratulations @TJWallasch! #CA08 is rooting for you. #RaisedHere https://t.co/Kv13AIajaO https://t.co/5JhNsQm4en

I am very pleased that my bill to create a Japanese American WWII History Network passed Natural Resources Cmte. This @natlparkservice network will help ensure stories of +120,000 American citizens are heard & remembered as part of our nation's history. https://t.co/9VNmsDbetU https://t.co/GDWZea1RQ6

The debt limit forces Congress to discuss how we plan to pay back the trillions we're borrowing. According to @USCBO, unless something changes, in 30yrs we will spend over half of federal tax revenue just paying interest on the debt. The process isn’t broken- Congress is.

Today House Budget Committee held a hearing on possible removal of the federal debt limit. Unfortunately, it’s clear that doing so would enable more deficit spending, not address the larger problem of our rapidly rising national debt (now at over $90,000 for every American). https://t.co/HRn0Y649yp

Inflation in January reached an alarming 7.5%. Because the average worker only received a 3% raise last year, real hourly earnings have actually declined, leaving more and more Americans struggling to pay their bills. https://t.co/oLnNayDhBW

Last weekend 13 police officers were shot and wounded across the country in just 24 hours. This war on our police cannot continue. Our law enforcement officers risk their lives to keep our community safe. They deserve our support in return. https://t.co/TSs5Y57R5E
Dusty Henriksen grew up in #CA08's Big Bear until he was 12 then moved to Mammoth Lakes. Now, he's a United States Olympian. Congratulations Dusty! #RaisedHere https://t.co/qNCUx4ZSgW
According to this week’s report from the Department of Labor, the last time inflation was this high I was sporting a mullet- it was 1982. https://t.co/e6P0qoDAXB

This week I joined my colleagues to recognize the dedication of law enforcement officers in #CA08 & across our country. Despite 346 shootings of officers & record levels of violent crime, these men & women continue to go above & beyond the call of duty to protect our community. https://t.co/9cbcPq5zJK

#CA08 competitor Alix Wilkinson of Mammoth Lakes made the U.S. Olympic Team for the first time following a personal best in the downhill at this year's World Cup. Congratulations Alix! We will be cheering you on. #RaisedHere https://t.co/9Vw2YUZaT7 https://t.co/4aErrEteP3

Monday marked the legal deadline for POTUS to submit his FY23 budget to Congress. Unfortunately we have yet to receive it. Budgeting is the vital process of adjusting our revenue & expenditures to plan for the future. Failing to even introduce a budget is no way to run a country.
#CA08 native @maddie_mastro from Wrightwood competed in the Olympics last night in the Women’s Halfpipe! Maddie, we are proud of you and all you have accomplished. #RaisedHere https://t.co/ibQ52UFNvo

I was proud to support a bill yesterday that will give small business owners a fair shot to win federal contracts and grow their businesses. Ensuring that our small businesses have equal opportunities to procure federal contracts is critical to our country’s economic health.

Last year's 97 fentanyl-related deaths in San Bernardino County are the direct result of the southern border crisis. While fentanyl seizures at the border increased 134%, @sbcountysheriff seized more than $26 million of fentanyl that made it to our streets. https://t.co/mMMr4cI93x

Our national debt passed $30T for the first time ever last week. This reckless deficit spending is hurting every American, with paychecks across our country worth less today than yesterday. We must stop the spending spree, balance the budget, and put our economy back on track. https://t.co/GzfLIrhQv5

The America COMPETES Act abandons the productive bipartisan work of the past year in favor of a nearly 3,000-page bill with numerous unrelated provisions & a bloated $325 billion price tag. This bill is not a serious proposal. We must return to the work we set out to accomplish. https://t.co/H2OnEb5HjX

Shockingly, Fentanyl deaths in @SBCounty increased 656% since 2018. Unfortunately my colleagues blocked a vote yesterday on HALT Fentanyl Act, which would make the emergency class-wide scheduling order expiring on Feb. 18 permanent. We need action now to keep our community safe. https://t.co/lgYMYTZgFl

I was proud to see CA's first renewable natural gas facility commissioned in Victorville. We need to adopt an all-of-the above approach to produce clean, reliable & affordable energy. When we produce energy domestically, we improve national security & decrease global emissions. https://t.co/p5QmnakGRw

If you haven’t already, this new year is a great time to sign up for my e-newsletter. Each week I share important updates on the critical issues facing Congress and my work on behalf of our district. Sign up here to stay informed: https://t.co/1J6Mea6zHw

The history of Japanese American internment during World War II includes sites such as the Manzanar Relocation Center in #CA08’s Inyo County. I am proud to introduce a bill to help ensure the stories of those unjustly imprisoned in Manzanar are told: https://t.co/paoFypp1cy

Last week I supported a bill to provide additional support to schools where revenue is impacted by federal activity such as military bases & national parks. Our future lies in our children, and they deserve the opportunity and resources they need to succeed.

I am proud to join @RepSteel in calling on AG Garland to help combat the train robberies we have seen in the Los Angeles area. This looting is dangerous to public safety and disruptive to the supply chain. We must uphold law and order and end this reign of crime. https://t.co/AWNvaQaQXB

It’s clear that the Administration and Congress need to stop using this crisis as an excuse to reshape our economy and instead focus on getting our spending and our national debt under control. More from this week’s @FoxBusiness interview here: https://t.co/cT5xHxwFCd

When inflation is caused by government action, it represents an unseen tax paid by every American. The Dec. jobs report emphasized this truth.

We must recognize the effects of reckless spending on the middle class, the growth of poverty & ability to achieve the American Dream. https://t.co/pzkx6SJaEL

New data from @USDOL makes it clear that Congress must redirect its efforts away from deficit spending and radical reforms to common sense solutions that will put our country back on track. I joined @FoxBusiness Evening Edit to discuss this and more: https://t.co/cT5xHxwFCd

Data released last week shows inflation hit a 40yr high in Dec. leading to a decline in real wages by +2%. Hard-working Americans can't afford the irresponsible government spending driving this inflation. We must act to put our nation back on track. https://t.co/XLeH8fezEq

Our nation might sometimes seem divided, but leaders throughout our history like Martin Luther King Jr. have shared a vision for a better future. On this #MLKDay, let us stand firm in his conviction that, in time, peace and love will prevail. https://t.co/FSf758HR9w

Government policies and irresponsible federal spending have led to this economic crisis, and the solution is simple: we must end this reckless spending, responsibly balance the federal budget, and put our nation and economy back on a path towards success.

Thanks to the highest inflation since 1982, American families are making less while paying more for almost everything. Beef & bacon are up 18.6%, eggs 11% & coffee 7%. Propane & firewood are up 34% while gas is up nearly 50%. Real wages declined 8/11 full months this Congress. https://t.co/vlqu0Ovv7V

I am glad to see the Supreme Court confirm the Administration’s vaccine mandate on private businesses is an unconstitutional government overreach into the lives of private citizens. I sent an amicus brief urging the court to block this mandate, and I am glad that they agree.

When inflation is caused by government action, it represents an unseen tax on every American. We must get our fiscal house in order by balancing the budget & getting government spending under control to ease the inflationary pressures driving more & more Americans into poverty. https://t.co/ZRf1q9iN2j

More than 1 in 4 Americans reported they sacrificed basic expenses to pay their energy bill last year. If your family experienced hardships such as these, I want to hear from you. Follow the link, message me, or reply to this tweet to share your story: https://t.co/XcjC1fBOrr

More fentanyl was seized at the southern border in FY2021 than in the previous 2 years combined & even more has made its way into our community undetected. As our sheriff's departments work to combat this increase, it is critical Congress act immediately to secure the border.

The @DEAHQ issued its first public safety alert in 6 years as fentanyl continues to flood across our southern border. The U.S. has seen a sharp increase in fake pills laced with lethal doses of fentanyl & meth that are causing an alarming spike in deaths. https://t.co/RqTA1TRZBG

January is Human Trafficking Prevention Month. With cases of human trafficking linked to illegal marijuana cultivation sites rising in our community, it is critical we put an end to this modern-day slavery. Learn more about the faces of human trafficking: https://t.co/4KZAFAmdr9

It was an honor to speak regarding the current state of U.S. cybersecurity at #CES2022 over the weekend. This week our community mourns the passing of @BarstowFire Engineer David Spink who was critically injured while responding to a traffic collision on the 15 freeway. Dave served 30 years with the department. Our hearts are with his family and the Barstow community. https://t.co/arsez6OLIY

In memory of #EverydayHero Gina Martinez, a Probation Corrections Supervisor w/ @SBCprobation who lost her life after 21 years of service. California ranks as the third-highest state for law enforcement officers shot in the line of duty this year. This violence against our public servants cannot be allowed to continue. We must ensure the safety of our communities and enforce the rule of law. https://t.co/Q59bmkFDHm

Passed by Congress in 1789, the Bill of Rights grants the American people with essential rights that protect us from unchecked government power. Today we celebrate these constitutional freedoms & recommit ourselves to ensuring that they are never infringed upon. #BillofRightsDay https://t.co/51cigPvu7l

The House has been called back into session this week to once again vote to raise the debt ceiling without any discussion of how this debt will ever be repaid. The reckless spending spree cannot continue. We need to balance our budget and get spending under control.

The House moved this bill forward without considering this information despite requests by myself and 206 other members of Congress to know the costs prior to a vote. Today as we sit at a near 40-year high for inflation, I urge the Senate to stop this over-priced bill. https://t.co/hEPPWRKOFq

.@USCBO released its estimate of the full cost of the massive social spending bill and it validates what I've feared for months - contrary to claims, this bill will add $3 TRILLION to the federal debt and cost $4.9-$5.1 TRILLION in spending. https://t.co/kgMrw6XiIf
